AdditionalInferenceSpecificationDefiniti.description: Additional Inference Specification specifies details about inference jobs that can be run with models based on this model package.AdditionalInferenceSpecifications can be added to existing model packages using AdditionalInferenceSpecificationsToAdd.

properties.name: Containers
properties.description: The Amazon ECR registry path of the Docker image that contains the inference code.

type.description: The Amazon ECR registry path of the Docker image that contains the inference code.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: A description of the additional Inference specification.

type.description: A description of the additional Inference specification.

properties.name: Name
properties.description: A unique name to identify the additional inference specification. The name must be unique within the list of your additional inference specifications for a particular model package.

type.description: A unique name to identify the additional inference specification. The name must be unique within the list of your additional inference specifications for a particular model package.

properties.name: SupportedContentTypes
properties.description: The supported MIME types for the input data.

type.description: The supported MIME types for the input data.

properties.name: SupportedRealtimeInferenceInstanceTypes
properties.description: A list of the instance types that are used to generate inferences in real-time

type.description: A list of the instance types that are used to generate inferences in real-time

properties.name: SupportedResponseMIMETypes
properties.description: The supported MIME types for the output data.

type.description: The supported MIME types for the output data.

properties.name: SupportedTransformInstanceTypes
properties.description: A list of the instance types on which a transformation job can be run or on which an endpoint can be deployed.

type.description: A list of the instance types on which a transformation job can be run or on which an endpoint can be deployed.

AdditionalInferenceSpecifications.description: An array of additional Inference Specification objects.

ApprovalDescription.description: A description provided for the model approval.

Bias.description: Contains bias metrics for a model.

CertifyForMarketplace.description: Whether to certify the model package for listing on AWS Marketplace.

ClientToken.description: A unique token that guarantees that the call to this API is idempotent.

ContentType.description: The supported MIME type for the input data.

CreationTime.description: The time at which the model package was created.

CustomerMetadataProperties.description: The metadata properties associated with the model package versions.

DataSource.description: Describes the input source of a transform job and the way the transform job consumes it.

Domain.description: The machine learning domain of the model package you specified.

DriftCheckBaselines.description: Represents the drift check baselines that can be used when the model monitor is set using the model package.

DriftCheckBias.description: Represents the drift check bias baselines that can be used when the model monitor is set using the model package.

DriftCheckExplainability.description: Contains explainability metrics for a model.

DriftCheckModelDataQuality.description: Represents the drift check data quality baselines that can be used when the model monitor is set using the model package.

DriftCheckModelQuality.description: Represents the drift check model quality baselines that can be used when the model monitor is set using the model package.

Environment.description: Sets the environment variables in the Docker container

Explainability.description: Contains explainability metrics for a model.

ModelApprovalStatus.description: The approval status of the model package.

ModelDataQuality.description: Metrics that measure the quality of the input data for a model.

ModelPackageArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model package group.

properties.description: The Amazon EC2 Container Registry (Amazon ECR) path where inference code is stored.

properties.description: A structure with Model Input details.

type.description: The input configuration object for the model.

ModelPackageDescription.description: The description of the model package.

ModelPackageStatus.description: The current status of the model package.

ModelPackageStatusDetails.description: Details about the current status of the model package.

properties.description: If the overall status is Failed, the reason for the failure.

ModelQuality.description: Metrics that measure the quality of a model.

properties.name: S3DataType
properties.description: The S3 Data Source Type

type.description: The S3 Data Source Type

properties.name: S3Uri
properties.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest.

type.description: Depending on the value specified for the S3DataType, identifies either a key name prefix or a manifest.

SamplePayloadUrl.description: The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) path where the sample payload are stored pointing to single gzip compressed tar archive.

SkipModelValidation.description: Indicates if you want to skip model validation.

SourceAlgorithm.description: Specifies an algorithm that was used to create the model package. The algorithm must be either an algorithm resource in your Amazon SageMaker account or an algorithm in AWS Marketplace that you are subscribed to.

properties.name: AlgorithmName
properties.description: The name of an algorithm that was used to create the model package. The algorithm must be either an algorithm resource in your Amazon SageMaker account or an algorithm in AWS Marketplace that you are subscribed to.

type.description: The name of an algorithm that was used to create the model package. The algorithm must be either an algorithm resource in your Amazon SageMaker account or an algorithm in AWS Marketplace that you are subscribed to.

properties.name: ModelDataUrl
properties.description: The Amazon S3 path where the model artifacts, which result from model training, are stored. This path must point to a single gzip compressed tar archive (.tar.gz suffix).

type.description: The Amazon S3 path where the model artifacts, which result from model training, are stored. This path must point to a single gzip compressed tar archive (.tar.gz suffix).

SourceAlgorithmSpecification.description: Details about the algorithm that was used to create the model package.

properties.name: SourceAlgorithms
properties.description: A list of algorithms that were used to create a model package.

type.description: A list of algorithms that were used to create a model package.

Tag.description: A key-value pair to associate with a resource.

properties.name: Key
properties.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The key name of the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 127 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 255 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

type.description: The value for the tag. You can specify a value that is 1 to 255 Unicode characters in length and cannot be prefixed with aws:. You can use any of the following characters: the set of Unicode letters, digits, whitespace, _, ., /, =, +, and -.

Task.description: The machine learning task your model package accomplishes.

TransformInput.description: Describes the input source of a transform job and the way the transform job consumes it.

properties.name: CompressionType
properties.description: If your transform data is compressed, specify the compression type. Amazon SageMaker automatically decompresses the data for the transform job accordingly. The default value is None.

type.description: If your transform data is compressed, specify the compression type. Amazon SageMaker automatically decompresses the data for the transform job accordingly. The default value is None.

properties.name: ContentType
properties.description: The multipurpose internet mail extension (MIME) type of the data. Amazon SageMaker uses the MIME type with each http call to transfer data to the transform job.

type.description: The multipurpose internet mail extension (MIME) type of the data. Amazon SageMaker uses the MIME type with each http call to transfer data to the transform job.

properties.name: SplitType
properties.description: The method to use to split the transform job's data files into smaller batches.

type.description: The method to use to split the transform job's data files into smaller batches.

TransformInstanceType.description: Instance types on which a transformation job can be run or on which an endpoint can be deployed.

TransformJobDefinition.description: Defines the input needed to run a transform job using the inference specification specified in the algorithm.

properties.name: BatchStrategy
properties.description: A string that determines the number of records included in a single mini-batch.

type.description: A string that determines the number of records included in a single mini-batch.

properties.name: MaxConcurrentTransforms
properties.description: The maximum number of parallel requests that can be sent to each instance in a transform job. The default value is 1.

type.description: The maximum number of parallel requests that can be sent to each instance in a transform job. The default value is 1.

properties.name: MaxPayloadInMB
properties.description: The maximum payload size allowed, in MB. A payload is the data portion of a record (without metadata).

type.description: The maximum payload size allowed, in MB. A payload is the data portion of a record (without metadata).

TransformOutput.description: Describes the results of a transform job.

properties.name: Accept
properties.description: The MIME type used to specify the output data. Amazon SageMaker uses the MIME type with each http call to transfer data from the transform job.

type.description: The MIME type used to specify the output data. Amazon SageMaker uses the MIME type with each http call to transfer data from the transform job.

properties.name: AssembleWith
properties.description: Defines how to assemble the results of the transform job as a single S3 object.

type.description: Defines how to assemble the results of the transform job as a single S3 object.

properties.name: KmsKeyId
properties.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.

type.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt the model artifacts at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.

properties.name: S3OutputPath
properties.description: The Amazon S3 path where you want Amazon SageMaker to store the results of the transform job.

type.description: The Amazon S3 path where you want Amazon SageMaker to store the results of the transform job.

TransformResources.description: Describes the resources, including ML instance types and ML instance count, to use for transform job.

properties.name: InstanceCount
properties.description: The number of ML compute instances to use in the transform job. For distributed transform jobs, specify a value greater than 1. The default value is 1.

type.description: The number of ML compute instances to use in the transform job. For distributed transform jobs, specify a value greater than 1. The default value is 1.

properties.name: InstanceType
properties.description: The ML compute instance type for the transform job.

type.description: The ML compute instance type for the transform job.

properties.name: VolumeKmsKeyId
properties.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt model data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the batch transform job.

type.description: The AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) key that Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt model data on the storage volume attached to the ML compute instance(s) that run the batch transform job.

ValidationProfile.description: Contains data, such as the inputs and targeted instance types that are used in the process of validating the model package.

properties.name: ProfileName
properties.description: The name of the profile for the model package.

type.description: The name of the profile for the model package.

ValidationSpecification.description: Specifies configurations for one or more transform jobs that Amazon SageMaker runs to test the model package.

properties.name: ValidationRole
properties.description: The IAM roles to be used for the validation of the model package.

type.description: The IAM roles to be used for the validation of the model package.

properties.name: Tags
properties.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

type.description: An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.
